results.title: The Body fights disease
results.brief_description: Describes the body’s mechanisms for fighting germs and preventing illness. Deals with the existence of germs and the role of the skin, antibodies, lymphatic system and vaccination. Suitable for upper primary, lower and middle secondary levels.

results.title: The Bob Knowlton story
results.creator_credit: Arthur Swerdloff, Leon S. Gold and Roundtable Productions
results.brief_description: Based on a case study by Dr Alex Bavelas and written by Bernard Fein and Malvin Wald. This instructional film focuses on communication, productivity, performance and staff management including team work and leadership roles.

results.title: The Blue ringed octopus
results.creator_credit: Wave Productions and Western Australia. Audio-Visual Education Branch
results.brief_description: Describes the venomous blue-ringed octopus, found in all coastal waters of Australia. If touched, this tiny creature’s rough skin causes abrasions through which a toxic and lethal poison enters the body, affects the nervous system, and paralyses the victim. There is no anti-venene, but the treatment is shown. No other credits available.

results.title: The Blue men of Morocco
results.brief_description: The strange story of a mysterious nomadic desert tribe of Arabs almost unknown to the outside world. The religious customs and strange ways of life of these people whose skin acquires its colour from the dye in their clothing. Explains how the tribe earns a living and describes a camel trip over the Sahara Desert and across the Atlas mountains to the city of Marrakesh. No other credits available.

results.title: The Blowfly
results.brief_description: This film depicts the life-cycle of one of the most common blowflies, the blue-bottle, calliphora erythrocephala. It is the big blue fly which everybody has seen settling on meat or occasionally buzzing about in the house.

results.title: The Blood [SILENT]
results.brief_description: The nature and function of the blood, with particular stress on the red and white corpuscles and the plasma. Explanations by use of animation. Contains descriptive captions.
